sentence.Network_en: Well, at any rate, let me thank you for all you did.
sentence.Network_cn: 好吧，不管怎样，还是要感谢你所做的一切。

sentence.Network_en: Thank God they're not on my manor any more.
sentence.Network_cn: 谢天谢地，他们再也不在我的辖区里了。

sentence.Network_en: The policeman smiled at her. "Pretty dog."— "Oh well, thank you."
sentence.Network_cn: 警察冲她笑了笑，“这狗真漂亮。”——“哦，谢谢。”

phrase.cizu_name: I will thank you to do something

jx.jx_en_mean: used to make a request or command and implying a reproach or annoyance
jx.jx_cn_mean: （表责备、生气时的请求）拜托，请

lj.lj_ly: I'll thank you not to interrupt me again.

phrase.cizu_name: thank goodness (或 God 或 heavens)

lj.lj_ly: thank goodness no one was badly injured.

jx.jx_en_mean: feel grateful for one's good fortune
jx.jx_cn_mean: 感谢自己的好运气，自庆幸运

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English thancian, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch and German danken; compare with thanks

entry.def: You use thank you or, in more informal English, thanks to express your gratitude when someone does something for you or gives you what you want.

example.ex: Thank you very much for your call...

entry.tran: 谢谢你，多谢(用于有礼貌地接受或拒绝)
entry.def: You use thank you or, in more informal English, thanks to politely accept or refuse something that has just been offered to you.

example.ex: 'You'd like a cup as well, would you, Mr Secombe?' — 'Thank you, Jane, I'd love one.'...
example.tran: “塞科姆先生，你也想来一杯吧？”——“谢谢，简，我确实想来一杯。”

example.ex: 'Would you like a cigarette?' — 'No thank you.'...

entry.tran: 谢谢你，多谢(尤用于礼貌地感谢对方的回答或所说的令人开心的话)
entry.def: You use thank you or, in more informal English, thanks to politely acknowledge what someone has said to you, especially when they have answered your question or said something nice to you.

example.ex: The policeman smiled at her. 'Pretty dog.' — 'Oh well, thank you.'...
example.tran: 警察冲她笑了笑，“这狗真漂亮。”——“哦，谢谢。”

example.ex: 'His eyes were glassy?' — 'And dilated. They were watery.' — 'Thank you.'...
example.tran: “他的眼神呆滞？”——“还双眼圆睁，泪汪汪的。”——“谢谢！”

entry.tran: 谢谢，非常感谢(用于坚决回绝别人的帮助或表示不喜欢别人的举动)
entry.def: You use thank you or thank you very much in order to say firmly that you do not want someone's help or to tell them that you do not like the way that they are behaving towards you.

example.ex: I can stir my own tea, thank you...
example.tran: 我的茶我自己会搅，谢谢。

example.ex: We know where we can get it, thank you very much.
example.tran: 我们知道在哪儿能买到，谢谢。

entry.def: When you thank someone for something, you express your gratitude to them for it.

example.ex: I thanked them for their long and loyal service...
example.tran: 我感谢他们长期以来忠诚的效力。

example.ex: When the decision was read out Mrs Gardner thanked the judges.
example.tran: 判决书宣读完，加德纳夫人向法官们表示感谢。

entry.def: When you express your thanks to someone, you express your gratitude to them for something.

example.ex: They accepted their certificates with words of thanks.
example.tran: 他们一边道谢，一边接过证书。

entry.def: When people give thanks, they thank God for something good that has happened.

example.ex: We give thanks for this food.
example.tran: 感谢上帝赐给我们食物。

entry.def: You say 'Thank God', 'Thank Goodness', or 'Thank heavens' when you are very relieved about something.

example.ex: Thank heavens we have you here.
example.tran: 谢天谢地，我们可等到你了。

entry.def: If you say that you have someone to thank for something, you mean that you are grateful to them because they caused it to happen.

example.ex: I have her to thank for my life...
For all this I have only you to thank.
example.tran: 这一切我都得感谢你才是。

entry.def: If you say that something happens thanks to a particular person or thing, you mean that they are responsible for it happening or caused it to happen.

example.ex: It is thanks to this committee that many new sponsors have come forward...
example.tran: 又有许多赞助商找上门来，这要归功于这个委员会。

example.ex: Thanks to recent research, effective treatments are available.
example.tran: 多亏近来的研究才有了有效的疗法。

entry.tran: 并非由于…才(发生);并不归功于
entry.def: If you say that something happens no thanks to a particular person or thing, you mean that they did not help it to happen, or that it happened in spite of them.

example.ex: It is no thanks to the Government that net assets did rise.
example.tran: 净资产的确增长了，但这与政府无关。

means.word_mean: 1. express gratitude or show appreciation to

auth_sentence.content: Porter Dr Roland Salmon, thank you very much.
auth_sentence.res_content: Porter Dr Roland Salmon, thank you very much.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Porter Dr Roland Salmon, thank you very much.

auth_sentence.content: Porter Professor David Salisbury, thank you very much.
auth_sentence.res_content: Porter Professor David Salisbury, thank you very much.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Porter Professor David Salisbury, thank you very much.

auth_sentence.content: Thank you, Chandos, for another fitting epitaph.
auth_sentence.res_content: Thank you, Chandos, for another fitting epitaph.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Thank you, Chandos, for another fitting epitaph.

Sentence.sentence: Thanks to men like Curtice, "the bonds of scarcity" had been broken and America was rolling "to an all-time high of prosperity".
Thank you very much for coming this afternoon.
And that box there to confirm you have known driving convictions, thank you, and then sign there.
To thank them for their hospitality.
And to those students who protest this tough-love teaching style: you'll thank me later.

sentences.en: I thank you that you have done this for me.
sentences.cn: 谢谢你替我做完了这件事。

sentences.en: To my shame, I never thanked him for his kindness.
sentences.cn: 我感到惭愧的是对他的好意我从未表示过感谢。

sentences.en: Thank heaven it only lasts an hour.
sentences.cn: 谢天谢地, 这只持续了一小时。

sentences.en: He has only himself to thank that he has lost his job.
sentences.cn: 他被解雇了, 这只能怪他自己。

means.word_mean: 感谢, 谢谢, 道谢的话

sentences.en: The old man gave thanks to me.

jushi.english: “Dr. White,”said the old man, very much moved,“How can I ever thank you!”
jushi.chinese: 老人感激地说：“怀特医生!可真得感谢你呀!”

jushi.english: I don't know how I can possibly thank you enough.
jushi.chinese: 我真不知怎样来感谢你。
